basics.name: Max Argus
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: Postdoc with computer vision and robotics labs.

work.name: Department of Computer Science, University of Freiburg
highlights: Supervising PhD students, including project planning, writing project proposals for funding, assessing applicants, supervising Masters and Bachelors theses
Holding lectures, creating presentations and figures, presenting at international conferences
Coordinating collaboration between departments and research groups, e.g. the university hospital and robotics lab, presentations to stakeholders at different organizational levels
Organizing team building and social events, including group retreats
Published 20 papers with 919 citations in total

work.name: Department of Computer Science, University of Freiburg
highlights: Researched and published papers at top conferences in the areas of computer vision, reinforcement learning, and self-supervised learning, etc.
Supervised seminars, Bachelor and Master theses

work.name: Symbio Robotics
work.position: Research Intern, Andressen Horowitz Internship Program
highlights: Developed computer vision algorithms for the rapid automation of manual tasks in automotive vehicle assembly
Company wide final project presentation, publication of results in academic journal

work.name: Radboud University
highlights: Researched computer vision algorithms for the automated assessment of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) from CT scans in the context of medical screening
Project conception for self-supervised learning of image diagnoses

work.name: University of Berkeley
highlights: Researched self-supervised pre-training for reinforcement learning at BAIR with Professor Trevor Darell

work.name: Mercedes-Benz Group
work.position: Intern & Software Engineer, Visual Perception Group
highlights: Developed computer vision algorithms for 3D map reconstruction, optical flow and evaluated CNNs for vehicle detection at the visual perception group

work.name: German Areospace Center
highlights: Designed and implemented a grasp planner for the Justin and Hasy robots as well as physics simulation integrating Bullet Physics Engine with the OpenRave project

work.name: Goldman Sachs
work.position: Intern, Fixed Income Currency and Commodities (FICC)
highlights: Immersive internship focused on understanding all operational areas with a focus on smart order routing algorithmic trading systems

work.name: PIMCO
highlights: Conceived and implemented a system to parse and format risk report data into an email mailing list for effective distribution using Django and SQL

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
